intro: Raphanus sativus f. esculentus, commonly known as the garden radish, is a cultivated form of the wild radish plant. It is characterized by its swollen, edible root that varies in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with pinnately lobed leaves and small white or pink flowers. The root is the primary edible part, valued for its crisp texture and slightly spicy flavor. It is widely grown in temperate regions for both culinary and ornamental purposes.
